text: In 2016, we lost 64,000 Americans to drug overdoses â 174 deaths per day; 7 per hour.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We must get much tougher on drug dealers and pushers if we are going to succeed in stopping this scourge.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: My administration is committed to fighting the drug epidemic and helping get treatment for those in need, for those who have been so terribly hurt.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The struggle will be long and it will be difficult, but as Americans always do â in the end, we will succeed.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We will prevail.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: As we have seen tonight, the most difficult challenges bring out the best in America.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We see a vivid expression of this truth in the story of the Holets family of New Mexico.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Ryan Holets is 27 years old, an officer with the Albuquerque Police Department.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Heâs here tonight with his wife Rebecca.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you, Ryan.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Last year, Ryan was on duty when he saw a pregnant, homeless woman preparing to inject heroin.

speaker: TRUMP
text: When Ryan told her she was going to harm her unborn child, she began to weep.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She told him she didnât know where to turn, but badly wanted a safe home for her baby.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In that moment, Ryan said he felt God speak to him: "You will do it, because you can."

speaker: TRUMP
text: He heard those words.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He took out a picture of his wife and their four kids.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Then, he went home to tell his wife Rebecca.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In an instant, she agreed to adopt.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The Holets named their new daughter Hope.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Ryan and Rebecca, you embody the goodness of our nation.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you, Ryan and Rebecca.

speaker: TRUMP
text: As we rebuild Americaâs strength and confidence at home, we are also restoring our strength and standing abroad.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Around the world, we face rogue regimes, terrorist groups, and rivals like China and Russia that challenge our interests, our economy, and our values.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In confronting these horrible dangers, we know that weakness is the surest path to conflict, and unmatched power is the surest means to our true and great defense.

speaker: TRUMP
text: For this reason, I am asking Congress to end the dangerous defense sequester and fully fund our great military.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: As part of our defense, we must modernize and rebuild our nuclear arsenal, hopefully never having to use it, but making it so strong and so powerful that it will deter any acts of aggression by any other nation or anyone else.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Perhaps someday in the future, there will be a magical moment when the countries of the world will get together to eliminate their nuclear weapons.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Unfortunately, we are not there yet, sadly.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Last year, I also pledged that we would work with our allies to extinguish ISIS from the face of the Earth.

speaker: TRUMP
text: One year later, I am proud to report that the coalition to defeat ISIS has liberated very close to 100 percent of the territory just recently held by these killers in Iraq and in Syria and in other locations, as well.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: But there is much more work to be done.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We will continue our fight until ISIS is defeated.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Army Staff Sergeant Justin Peck is here tonight.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Near Raqqa, last November, Justin and his comrade, Chief Petty Officer Kenton Stacy, were on a mission to clear buildings that ISIS had rigged with explosive so that civilians could return to that city hopefully soon, and hopefully safely.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Clearing the second floor of a vital hospital, Kenton Stacy was severely wounded by an explosion.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Immediately, Justin bounded into the booby-trapped and unbelievably dangerous and unsafe building, and found Kenton, but in very, very bad shape.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He applied pressure to the wound and inserted a tube to reopen an airway.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He then performed CPR for 20 straight minutes during the ground transport, and maintained artificial respiration through two and a half hours and through emergency surgery.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Kenton Stacy would have died if it were not for Justinâs selfless love for his fellow warrior.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Tonight, Kenton is recovering in Texas.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Raqqa is liberated.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And Justin is wearing his new Bronze Star, with a "V" for "valor."

speaker: TRUMP
text: Staff Sergeant Peck, all of America salutes you.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Terrorists who do things like place bombs in civilian hospitals are evil.

speaker: TRUMP
text: When possible, we have no choice but to annihilate them.

speaker: TRUMP
text: When necessary, we must be able to detain and question them.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we must be clear: Terrorists are not merely criminals.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They are unlawful enemy combatants.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: And when captured overseas, they should be treated like the terrorists they are.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In the past, we have foolishly released hundreds and hundreds of dangerous terrorists, only to meet them again on the battlefield â including the ISIS leader, al-Baghdadi, who we captured, who we had, who we released.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So today, Iâm keeping another promise.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I just signed, prior to walking in, an order directing Secretary Mattis, who is doing a great job, thank you â

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: â to reexamine our military detention policy and to keep open the detention facilities in Guantanamo Bay.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: I am asking Congress to ensure that, in the fight against ISIS and al Qaeda, we continue to have all necessary power to detain terrorists, wherever we chase them down, wherever we find them.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And in many cases, for them, it will now be Guantanamo Bay.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: At the same time, as of a few months ago, our warriors in Afghanistan have new rules of engagement.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Along with their heroic Afghan partners, our military is no longer undermined by artificial timelines, and we no longer tell our enemies our plans.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Last month, I also took an action endorsed unanimously by the U.S.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Senate just months before.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I recognized Jerusalem as the capital of Israel.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Shortly afterwards, dozens of countries voted in the United Nations General Assembly against Americaâs sovereign right to make this decision.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In 2016, American taxpayers generously sent those same countries more than $20 billion in aid.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That is why, tonight, I am asking Congress to pass legislation to help ensure American foreign-assistance dollars always serve American interests, and only go to friends of America, not enemies of America.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: As we strengthen friendships all around the world, we are also restoring clarity about our adversaries.

speaker: TRUMP

speaker: TRUMP
text: America stands with the people of Iran in their courageous struggle for freedom.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: I am asking Congress to address the fundamental flaws in the terrible Iran nuclear deal.

speaker: TRUMP
text: My administration has also imposed tough sanctions on the communist and socialist dictatorships in Cuba and Venezuela.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: But no regime has oppressed its own citizens more totally or brutally than the cruel dictatorship in North Korea.

speaker: TRUMP
text: North Koreaâs reckless pursuit of nuclear missiles could very soon threaten our homeland.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We are waging a campaign of maximum pressure to prevent that from ever happening.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Past experience has taught us that complacency and concessions only invite aggression and provocation.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I will not repeat the mistakes of past administrations that got us into this very dangerous position.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We need only look at the depraved character of the North Korean regime to understand the nature of the nuclear threat it could pose to America and to our allies.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Otto Warmbier was a hardworking student at the University of Virginia â and a great student he was.

speaker: TRUMP
text: On his way to study abroad in Asia, Otto joined a tour to North Korea.

speaker: TRUMP
text: At its conclusion, this wonderful young man was arrested and charged with crimes against the state.

speaker: TRUMP
text: After a shameful trial, the dictatorship sentenced Otto to 15 years of hard labor, before returning him to America last June, horribly injured and on the verge of death.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He passed away just days after his return.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Ottoâs wonderful parents, Fred and Cindy Warmbier, are here with us tonight, along with Ottoâs brother and sister, Austin and Greta.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Please.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Incredible people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You are powerful witnesses to a menace that threatens our world, and your strength truly inspires us all.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you very much.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Tonight, we pledge to honor Ottoâs memory with total American resolve.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Finally, we are joined by one more witness to the ominous nature of this regime.

speaker: TRUMP
text: His name is Mr.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Ji Seong-ho.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In 1996, Seong-ho was a starving boy in North Korea.

speaker: TRUMP
text: One day, he tried to steal coal from a railroad car to barter for a few scraps of food, which were very hard to get.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In the process, he passed out on the train tracks, exhausted from hunger.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He woke up as a train ran over his limbs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He then endured multiple amputations without anything to dull the pain or the hurt.

speaker: TRUMP
text: His brother and sister gave what little food they had to help him recover and ate dirt themselves, permanently stunting their own growth.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Later, he was tortured by North Korean authorities after returning from a brief visit to China.

speaker: TRUMP
text: His tormentors wanted to know if heâd met any Christians.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He had â and he resolved, after that, to be free.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Seong-ho traveled thousands of miles on crutches all across China and Southeast Asia to freedom.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Most of his family followed.

speaker: TRUMP
text: His father was caught trying to escape and was tortured to death.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Today he lives in Seoul, where he rescues other defectors, and broadcasts into North Korea what the regime fears most: the truth.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Today, he has a new leg.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But, Seong-ho, I understand you still keep those old crutches as a reminder of how far youâve come.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Your great sacrifice is an inspiration to us all.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Please.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Seong-hoâs story is a testament to the yearning of every human soul to live in freedom.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It was that same yearning for freedom that nearly 250 years ago gave birth to a special place called America.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It was a small cluster of colonies caught between a great ocean and a vast wilderness.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It was home to an incredible people with a revolutionary idea: that they could rule themselves; that they could chart their own destiny; and that, together, they could light up the entire world.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That is what our country has always been about.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That is what Americans have always stood for, always strived for, and always done.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Atop the dome of this Capitol stands the Statue of Freedom.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She stands tall and dignified among the monuments to our ancestors who fought, and lived, and died to protect her.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Monuments to Washington, and Jefferson, and Lincoln, and King.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Memorials to the heroes of Yorktown and Saratoga; to young Americans who shed their blood on the shores of Normandy and the fields beyond; and others, who went down in the waters of the Pacific and the skies all over Asia.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And freedom stands tall over one more monument: this one.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This Capitol â this living monument â this is the moment to the American people.

text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: AUDIENCE
text: USA!

speaker: AUDIENCE
text: USA!

speaker: TRUMP
text: Weâre a people whose heroes live not only in the past, but all around us, defending hope, pride, and defending the American way.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They work in every trade.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They sacrifice to raise a family.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They care for our children at home.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They defend our flag abroad.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And they are strong moms and brave kids.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They are firefighters, and police officers, and border agents, medics, and Marines.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But above all else, they are Americans.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And this Capitol, this city, this nation, belongs entirely to them.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our task is to respect them, to listen to them, to serve them, to protect them, and to always be worthy of them.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Americans fill the world with art and music.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They push the bounds of science and discovery.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And they forever remind us of what we should never, ever forget: The people dreamed this country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The people built this country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And itâs the people who are making America great again.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: TRUMP
text: As long as we are proud of who we are and what we are fighting for, there is nothing we cannot achieve.

speaker: TRUMP
text: As long as we have confidence in our values, faith in our citizens, and trust in our God, we will never fail.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our families will thrive.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our people will prosper.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And our nation will forever be safe and strong and proud and mighty and free.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And God bless America.

speaker: TRUMP

text: This is a guy you love?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Sure.

text: I know all these things.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I mean-- I'm not a baby.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I know these things.

text: I know, but why do you love that guy?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Look, look.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I-- I-- I like-- I get along with him, okay?

text: But you love him.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Okay.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That's just a figure of speech.

text: No, it's like an embrace.

text: It well, let it be an embrace.

text: Let it be whatever it is to get the job done.

text: He's a bad guy.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Look.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Let it be whatever it is.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I get along with him really well.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have a good energy with him.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have a good chemistry with him.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Look at the horrible threats that were made.

speaker: TRUMP
text: No more threats.

speaker: TRUMP
text: No more threats.

speaker: LESLEY STAHL
text: China.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I get along with him.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's very important.

speaker: TRUMP
text: China, let's go.

speaker: LESLEY STAHL
text: I'm skipping across the world here.

text: You've slapped a lot of tariffs--

speaker: TRUMP
text: $250 billion.

text: Gonna do more?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Might.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Might.

text: Round three?

text: They wanna negotiate, Lesley.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They wanna negotiate.

text: Are you ready?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Look.

speaker: LESLEY STAHL
text: Are you ready to--

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have a great chemistry also with President Xi of China.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I don't know that that's necessarily going to continue.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I told President Xi we cannot continue to have China take $500 billion a year out of the United States in the form of trade and others things.

speaker: LESLEY STAHL
text: And how-- how--

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I said we can't do that, and we're not gonna do that anymore.

speaker: LESLEY STAHL
text: How much squeezing of them are you prepared to do when American products are gonna be more expensive for American consumers in the end of all this?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Okay.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Okay.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So, so far, that hasn't turned out to be the case.

speaker: LESLEY STAHL
text: Some--

speaker: TRUMP
text: --if you think about it, so far, I put 25% tariffs on steel dumping, and aluminum dumping 10%.

text: But they've--

speaker: TRUMP
text: #NAME?

speaker: LESLEY STAHL
text: #NAME?

speaker: LESLEY STAHL
text: That's what I'm asking.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They can retaliate, but they can't-- they don't have enough ammunition to retaliate.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We do $100 billion with them.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They do $531 billion with us.

speaker: LESLEY STAHL
text: Are you trying to sort of push them into a depression?

speaker: TRUMP
text: No no, although they're down 32 percent in four months, which is 1929.

speaker: LESLEY STAHL
text: Well that's what I'm asking.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I don't want that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, I don't want that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I want them to negotiate a fair deal with us.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I want them to open their markets like our-- our markets are open.

text: But you're in a--

speaker: TRUMP
text: And it will be a fair deal--

speaker: LESLEY STAHL
text: #NAME?

text: Trade war.

text: You call it war, I don't call--

speaker: LESLEY STAHL
text: You-- you--

speaker: LESLEY STAHL
text: #NAME?

speaker: TRUMP
text: I called it a skirmish.

speaker: LESLEY STAHL
text: I heard you, you called it a war.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I called it, actually I called it a battle.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But, actually, I'm gonna lower that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I consider it a skirmish.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we're gonna win.

text: You have also slapped some tariffs on our allies.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I mean, what's an ally?

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have wonderful relationships with a lot of people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But nobody treats us much worse than the European Union.

text: The European Union was formed in order to take advantage of us on trade, and that's what they've done.

text: But this is hostile.

text: And yet, they-- it's not hostile.

text: It sounds hostile.

text: You know what's hostile?

speaker: TRUMP
text: The way they treat us.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We're not hostile.

speaker: LESLEY STAHL
text: No, but can't you deal with--

speaker: TRUMP
text: We've been-- we've been--

speaker: LESLEY STAHL
text: --them without--

speaker: TRUMP
text: #NAME?

speaker: LESLEY STAHL
text: Are you willing to get rid of that Western alliance?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, I like NATO, NATO's fine.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But you know what?

speaker: TRUMP
text: We shouldn't be paying almost the entire cost of NATO to protect Europe.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And then on top of that, they take advantage of us on trade.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They're not going to do it anymore.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They understand that.

speaker: LESLEY STAHL
text: Okay, but are, it does seem this, are you willing to disrupt the Western Alliance?

speaker: LESLEY STAHL
text: It's been going for 70 years.

speaker: LESLEY STAHL
text: It's kept the peace for 70 years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You don't know that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You don't know that.

speaker: LESLEY STAHL
text: I don't know what?

speaker: TRUMP
text: You don't know that.

speaker: LESLEY STAHL
text: Is it true General Mattis said to you, "The reason for NATO and the reason for all these alliances is to prevent World War III?"

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, it's not true.

speaker: LESLEY STAHL
text: What's not true?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Frankly, I like General Mattis.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think I know more about it than he does.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I know more about it from the standpoint of fairness, that I can tell you.

speaker: LESLEY STAHL
text: I'm gonna try one more time.

speaker: LESLEY STAHL
text: Okay.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I know-- and, Lesley, you don't have to try again.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I know exactly what you're saying--

speaker: LESLEY STAHL
text: Well, answer my question.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The answer is this.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I will always be there with NATO, but they have to pay their way.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I'm fully in favor of NATO, but I don't wanna be taken advantage of.

text: Putin.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yeah.

text: Okay, people don't understand why you never have a harsh word for Vladimir Putin.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Okay, you ready?

text: I don't understand it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have been-- you don't know what I talked about with Putin in the meeting prior to the press conference--

speaker: LESLEY STAHL
text: No, I mean publicly.

text: You never say anything harsh about him--

text: Excuse me.

speaker: LESLEY STAHL
text: #NAME?

speaker: TRUMP
text: I didn't?

speaker: TRUMP
text: I'm the one that gave Ukraine offensive weapons and tank killers.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Obama didn't.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You know what he sent?

speaker: TRUMP
text: He sent pillows and blankets.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I'm the one-- and he's the one that gave away a part of Ukraine where Russia now has this--

text: Well, I mean him personally Vladimir Putin--

text: I think I'm very tough with him personally.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I had a meeting with him.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The two of us.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It was a very tough meeting and it was a very good meeting.

text: Do you agree that Vladimir Putin is involved in assassinations?

text: In poisonings?

text: Probably.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I mean, I don't--

text: But I rely on them, it's not in our country.

text: Why not-- they shouldn't do it.

text: This is a terrible thing.

text: Of course they shouldn't do it-

text: That's your (Inaudible.)--

text: This is amazing.

text: #NAME?

text: I'm not doing anything.

text: You are, you are

speaker: TRUMP

text: So you've been president for almost two years.

text: So when I won the presidency, I th-- I-- I-- the press treats me terribly.

text: I thought very strongly that, you know, the one great thing will happen is the press will start treating me great.

text: Lesley, they treat me worse.

text: Very dishonest.

text: I'm-- I'm really asking (Inaudible.)--

text: Yeah.

text: And frankly, when you don't do separa-- when you allow the parents to stay together, okay, when you allow that, then what happens is people are gonna pour into our country.

text: Really what we wanna do is change the immigration laws, 'cause they were-- they were a laughing stock all over the world.

text: No, I want all the laws changed.

text: But the children specifically--

speaker: TRUMP
text: there have to be consequences, Lesley, for coming into our country illegally.

text: And part of the r-- I mean, part of the reason, I have to blame myself, the economy is so strong that everybody wants to come into the United States.

text: You said, "We're looking at everything."

text: I will--

text: I will only-- I can't-- you can't say yes or no.

speaker: TRUMP
text: What I can say is this: There are consequences from coming into a country, namely our country, illegally.

speaker: LESLEY STAHL
text: I'm not gonna ask it again--

speaker: TRUMP
text: You don't have to.

speaker: LESLEY STAHL
text: cause I know you won't-- it--

speaker: TRUMP
text: But it's the same as Obama.

text: Okay.

text: Changing subjects again-- you are the first president of the United States who never had a political post before, nor never served in the military.

text: You come up here, you've been here for almost two years, what's the biggest surprise and what have you learned since you've been president?

text: Okay.

text: So I always used to say the toughest people are Manhattan real estate guys and blah, blah.

text: Who's the toughest?

text: They're babies, the political people.

text: This is the most deceptive, vicious world.

text: It is vicious, it's full of lies, deceit and deception.

text: You make a deal with somebody and it's like making a deal with-- that table.

text: Remember that.

text: When you look at taxes, you look at regulations, you look at-- making deals with other countries.

text: Nobody's been able to do anything like this.

text: Actually, most people didn't even try because they knew they didn't have the ability to do it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But it's a very deceptive world.

text: The other thing I've really learned is I never knew how dishonest the media was.

text: I-- I-- and I really mean it.

text: I'm not saying that as a sound bite.

text: I never--

text: I'd like to--

text: Knew how dishonest--

text: I'm-- I'm gonna change the subject again.

text: Well, no, even the way you asked me a question, like, about separation.

text: When I say Obama did it, you don't wanna talk about it.

text: No, I'm gonna run your--

text: When I say I did it, let's make a big deal of it.

text: I'm just telling you that you treated me much differently on the subject.

text: Hey, it's okay--

text: Lesley, it's okay.

text: #NAME?

text: It was very polarized under President Obama, unbelievably polarized under President Obama.

text: I can see the country uniting.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I can see it.

text: We have people, Democrats, who behaved horribly during the Judge Kavanaugh-- you-- know what I'm saying.

text: But when you won that.

text: --during the hearings for the Supreme Court, we had senators that behaved horribly.

text: No-- no one is gonna argue with that.

text: I won--

text: #NAME?

text: We need--

text: I don't think they want to heal yet, I'll be honest.

text: Well, you don't wanna--

text: I think--

text: I-- I-- I saw Hillary Clinton made a really nasty statement.

text: I don't think they wanna be healed.

text: I do wanna heal.

text: I'm n-- I'm not talking about Democrat-- I'm talking about the country.

text: You go out and you go to Mississippi.

text: No (Inaudible.)--

text: And you're trying to destroy a life of a man who has been extraordinary.

text: Well, they were laughing.
